summary: The River Thames is England's longest river, stretching 215 miles. It starts in Gloucestershire and flows through London into the North Sea. It's known as the Isis in Oxford. The river has a big tide called the Tideway in London, with a 23-foot rise and fall. Despite its size, the Thames has a lower water flow compared to other rivers like the Severn. It has 45 locks and over 80 islands. The river is home to various wildlife and important nature reserves.
title: River Thames
